organization.$: Centre for Advanced Materials and Environmental Research
Graduate School of Engineering and oGreen Mobility Collaborative Research Center
Center of Excellence on Petrochemical and Materials Technology (PETRO-MAT)

head.citation-title: Route of glycerol conversion and product generation via TiO2-induced photocatalytic oxidation in the presence of H2O2
head.abstracts: © 2015 Elsevier B.V.The objective of this study was to explore the route of glycerol conversion and product generation via the TiO2-induced photocatalytic oxidation in the presence of H2O2. Effects of TiO2 dosage (1-3g/L), H2O2 concentration (0.3-1.5M), light UV intensity (1.1-4.7mW/cm2) and irradiation time (4-8h) on the level of glycerol conversion and product selectivity were identified using a 2k factorial design. It was found that TiO2 and H2O2 played a simultaneous positive effect on the glycerol conversion in the presence of UV-light. Among all investigated parameters, the most important parameter on glycerol conversion and product selectivity was the irradiation time. Glycerol conversion and product generation can proceed via both h+-mediate and radical-mediated routes, but the radical-mediated route was dominant.

classification.classification-description: Petroleum Refining and Petrochemicals; Chemical Products and Processes; Oxygen Compounds
Petroleum Refining and Petrochemicals; Catalysts and Catalysis; Chemicals-Processing Catalysts

Effects of TiO2 dosage (1-3g/L), H2O2 concentration (0.3-1.5M), light UV intensity (1.1-4.7mW/cm2) and irradiation time (4-8h) on the level of glycerol conversion and product selectivity were identified using a 2k factorial design. Glycerol conversion and product generation can proceed via both h+-mediate and radical-mediated routes, but the radical-mediated route was dominant.
coredata.dc:title: Route of glycerol conversion and product generation via TiO2-induced photocatalytic oxidation in the presence of H2O2
